subject: Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: Advice spoiled Square Eddie’s first start in three months, roaring from last place to take the $300,000 Lexington Stakes at Keeneland in Kentucky. Advice, trained by Todd Pletcher and owned by WinStar Farm, overtook Square Eddie with a spectacular move in the stretch, then held off Conservative to win by a length. It was his first win as a 3-year-old in the last major prep race for next month’s Kentucky Derby. Advice covered the one and one-sixteenth mile over Keeneland’s Polytrack in 1 minute 43.33 seconds. Square Eddie finished third.
